Speaker: joshua

Speaker: joshua

Dialogue: Male tarantulas compete for the female's attention.

Speaker: joshua
Dialogue: The prey is cocooned alive so she can eat them in her nest. You know how women love breakfast in bed.

Dialogue: Take a look, the female of the species is three times as big as the male.

Speaker: joshua
Dialogue: She fills her prey with digestive acid to liquify the internal organs. Now watch... She'll drink her victim from the inside out. While it's still alive!

Speaker: joshua
Dialogue: Arachnids have been roaming the earth for millions of years. And they'll be here long after the human race is dead and buried.

Dialogue: You   should see them, Mom. Each one   has a unique feeding behavior. The   spitters fire poisonous snot. The   tarantulas mummify their prey. The   jumpers can...

Dialogue: Why does he have all those things?

Dialogue: He studies them. NASA uses spider webs in outer space. And for medicine. They've been here forever, and they'll be here long after we're all dead.

Dialogue: U.P.S. brought this to the station.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It's from Dad! He didn't forget my birthday. I told you he wouldn't.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Is that the one you wanted?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Cassiopeia 2304 with 64 megs of ram. Integrated modem. Voice recording capability. This baby is tight.

Dialogue: I told him to send batteries.

Dialogue: There is something very sexy about an older woman in uniform.

Dialogue: I told you not to act like kamikazes. Especially with Ashley riding behind. That is unacceptable, Bret.

Dialogue: You just bought yourself a reckless.

Dialogue: No sweat, babydoll.       We'll hook up later.

Dialogue: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used...

Dialogue: Larry, do we know anybody at City Hall who can mark this go away?

Dialogue: Oh, yeah.  He signs your paycheck.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: The next time you put my daughter's life in danger, I'll show you exactly how little that means to me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I want both wheels on the ground.

Dialogue: Do you get off on humiliating me?

Dialogue: This bad girl act doesn't suit you, Ash.

Dialogue: I'm just trying to have fun. Don't you remember what it's like to grow up here?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I told you to keep this with you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: A mother's job is to protect her children.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: You need to start trusting me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'd like to. But you keep skipping classes to go to the dunes with Bret.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: Why do you hate him so much?

Dialogue: I don't hate him. I just want you to have a future. I thought you wanted to get out of town. Go to med school.

Dialogue: Maybe I want to stay. I could get pregnant by nineteen. Then divorce with a couple of kids I can't handle. Slap on a badge and be a trailer trash sheriff.

Dialogue: With one phone call I could put together a deal that would make us all very rich.

Dialogue: I've warned you not to talk about my family!

Dialogue: Am I supposed to be grateful?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: We have no economy! People are barely scraping by! And now we've been offered the deal of a lifetime. You don't have the right to stand in our way!

Dialogue: Those mines are full of gas. One spark in the wrong place could blow this entire valley sky high. Do you really want to load that gun with toxic waste?

Dialogue: Chem-Tech did seismic analysis, vapor checks, groundwater reads, soil sampling. They found isolated methane pockets, but no benzene or hydrogen sulfide.

Dialogue: How could they run tests? I didn't give them permission to go into the mines.

Dialogue: I asked you a question, you greedy son of a bitch!

Dialogue: I'm greedy?! You're the one keeping us down so you can search for gold!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm trying to keep the peace.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: You're crazy!    Just like your father!

Dialogue: You can't take your eyes off his butt.

Dialogue: You're right... I'm just worried about how we're going to pay these bills.

Dialogue: Don't give up on me, Gladys. I promised him I'd find the gold. And I will.

Dialogue: I don't know, Travis. We're gonna keep an eye out. But we're not gettin' anywhere like this. You should go back out there and look for your animals. If they haven't shown up by tonight. I'll call Fish and Game. Okay?

Dialogue: I need to know what happened to my birds!

Dialogue: That could be why the other species are coming out into the open. They're trying to get away from the giant spiders.  The ecosystem is out of balance.

Dialogue: I don't know. I want to do something with my life, Bret. Help people. Maybe med school is still an option.

Dialogue: I will live every moment of my life as if it were my last.

Dialogue: The phones went down for some reason. Maybe that's why Bret didn't call. Did you want to go ahead and order?

Dialogue: I wanted to surprise you with a special dinner. Turkey De La Gladys.

Dialogue: Get back to work. I'll see you tonight.

Dialogue: You two should just sleep together and get it over with.

Dialogue: I may be older than electricity, but I used to be a nice-looking piece of tail.

Dialogue: I'm not kidding. I got more action than those chicks on VIP. So when I tell you Sam thinks your butt is U.S.D.A. choice...

Dialogue: This is where I throw up.

Dialogue: Don't tell me you don't think she's a fox.

Dialogue: Nothing yet. I'm sorry.     We're still trying to get...

Dialogue: Let me call you back.  This has been one crazy day. We've got missing pets, dead ostriches. God only knows what's next.

Dialogue: I'm sorry about yesterday. Wade is... He knows how to push my buttons.

Dialogue: I'm kidding.   What did you want to ask?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Have you noticed anything strange in the mines?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I had spiders in my house. Hector had roaches in his basement. Some mice...

Dialogue: Were they running away from something?

Dialogue: Could have been. Never saw them do that before. I guess it qualifies as strange.

Dialogue: Only if you're going to say yes.

Dialogue: My kids are the world to me, Chris. When their dad left... it really took a toll. On all of us. I can't go through that again. I won't.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No... I understand... I don't know what I was thinking...  Gladys has some crazy ideas. I'm gonna kill her.

Dialogue: No!   Let me go! Gladys!   Let me go!

Dialogue: She was cooking. The stove was broken.

Dialogue: Why don't you come home with me? We'll get you cleaned up.

Dialogue: Then why is his truck out front?

Dialogue: What do you mean?     What happened?

Dialogue: Spiders shed their skins when they grow.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: This is a tarantula's leg. Or it was. It's an exoskeleton, to be scientific.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: See! Male tarantulas wrap their prey in webbing. Tight like a mummy. The food stays alive so they can eat it later.

Dialogue: Mike, please.    Now isn't the time.

Dialogue: No. That's a piece of cactus. Look... It's covered with spines.

Dialogue: Those are quills! Tarantulas can flick them at you like darts!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Tarantulas! Wolfs! Trapdoors! Joshua had a ton of exotics!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: If there were giant spiders roaming the desert, don't you think somebody would've seen them by now?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: The jumpers hunt in daylight. But not the others. They only come out when the sun goes down!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I guess I should watch more 'Oprah.' It must be a textbook 'no-dad' kind of thing.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: That one looks kind of scratchy.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: All Jason cared about was getting out and starting over. I guess that included buying a new wardrobe.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Gladys thought I should sell... but you know... I never wanted to get rich. If it was about the money, I would have sold out to Wade a long time ago.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I think I just wanted to prove the gold was down there. That my family wasn't crazy to keep looking. Even after we'd lost so much. And now... she's gone, too.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Do you know what I'm trying to say?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It wasn't about spending the gold, it was about finding it.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Remind me never to let you do my laundry.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: The scytodes spits a gooey discharge to immobilize their prey.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Watch its fangs! The spitter's fangs move from side to side as it fires!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Get under it! Stab it in the abdomen! They don't have any armor down there!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: How am I supposed to do that!?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm gonna need some new pants.

Dialogue: I told you! I told you all!     But nobody ever listens to Mike! Still think I'm crazy, Mom?

Dialogue: I'm sorry I didn't believe you.

Dialogue: There aren't enough wine coolers in the world to calm me down!

Dialogue: I won't let anything happen to you.

Dialogue: What other spiders did Joshua have?

Dialogue: Why couldn't he keep goldfish like a normal person?

Dialogue: Good one.    We'll go to Harlan's.

Dialogue: Outside?    You want to go outside?

Dialogue: ... I'm saying the invasion has already occurred. The aliens are among us. But they've taken common forms. They hide in plain sight.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We need to make an emergency broadcast.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: What are you going to say?   You can't tell them the truth.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Is this thing on? Hello? This is Sam Palmer. We have an emergency situation.

Dialogue: The walls are concrete and the exits have steel gates. We could hold an entire army of giant spiders from inside.

Dialogue: You just said giant spider on the air.

Dialogue: Not giant spiders!      I meant to say...

Dialogue: Wait, Mom! The noise will attract more of them!

Dialogue: Go ahead.    I've got your butt.

Dialogue: We're sealed up at both ends.

Dialogue: You pump the slide to jack in a fresh round. Point at your target and squeeze.

Dialogue: Why didn't we see them earlier?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: For the last time! They can't handle the sunlight. They were waiting in the mines for the sun to go down!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Then at daybreak they'll go back inside. We can walk out the front door.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We won't make it that long.

Speaker: ashley
Dialogue: They're gonna come in after us?

Dialogue: They're growing very fast. They need food to sustain that kind of development.

Dialogue: Someone should go out and get help.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't have that many handcuffs.

Dialogue: You're not goin' back out there, Pete. None of us are.

Dialogue: Radio Shack is full of cell phones.

Dialogue: But the signal won't get out of the valley. That's why we couldn't sell any of the damn things.

Dialogue: I could climb up to the top. I bet I could get a signal out.

Dialogue: Great idea.    You should do that.

Dialogue: Are you sure you can handle this?

Dialogue: While I'm gone, do you think you could find me a size 32?

Dialogue: I'll do my best.  Uhh... Do you want to go out sometime?  Dinner? Maybe a movie?

Dialogue: Hey, loverboy... you've got a town to save.

Dialogue: You're not really going to get him bigger pants are you?

Dialogue: Don't even think about locking this door.

Dialogue: How about a little off the top!

Dialogue: Did you get help?!    Is anybody coming!?

Dialogue: At least they can't follow us.

Dialogue: We can get out this way!

Dialogue: No, we can't.  Isn't that tunnel blocked off, Dad?

Dialogue: Uh... yeah... he's right.   We can't get out that way.

Dialogue: You put all of us at risk.

Dialogue: I think our lives are worth a little more than that.

Dialogue: One end of these lights should be connected to a generator. That'll be near the entrance.

Dialogue: My birds! You see, Sam? I wasn't lying! That's what I can put on the insurance form... giant spiders!

Dialogue: Methane.   This cavern is full of gas.

Dialogue: One spark and we're all dead.

Dialogue: That's what I was talking about, Chris. Presents from the male tarantula to the female.

Dialogue: Gladys, please...  Can anybody help her?!

Dialogue: Her breathing is shallow.       She's going into arrest.

Dialogue: Jesus... it's the mother lode... He was right. My dad was right...

Dialogue: Get as much as you can!

Dialogue: Have you got a smoke, kid?

Dialogue: The man says this cavern is full of highly flammable methane gas. I smoke to get high, not to die.

Dialogue: They don't have hair. They aren't fully grown tarantulas.

Dialogue: So you can keep it all!?   Hell no!
